results.title: This nuclear age
results.creator_credit: Jim Turpie, ONF | NFB, Crawley Films and Sally Macdonald
results.brief_description: Since the first film was made explaining the power of the atom, nuclear technology has made great advances. This film is an up-to-date account of the many areas of nuclear research and recent developments in Canada. It was filmed at the long-functioning atomic reactors at Chalk River and Rolphton, and at the latest and largest atomic power station at Pickering, as well as at laboratories across the land where experimentation is carried out in both pure and applied nuclear science.

results.title: This model age
results.brief_description: Shows the skill and ingenuity involved in making radio-controlled, diesel-engined and electric-powered toy models. The models range from conventional aircraft, trains and boats to futuristic transport designed for space exploration

results.title: This marching girl thing
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Kelli Simpson
results.brief_description: Cindy (Toni Collette), a baton twirler with the Southern Twirlettes is competing in the Victorian Baton Twirlers competition, her girlfriend Alison (Jenny Apostolou), and boyfriend Peter (Matt Day) in tow. As the results are announced, she questions whether she should continue pursuing “this marching girl thing”, and whether she should continue with Alison or Peter.

results.title: This life
results.brief_description: ‘This life’ - the series following the life and loves of twenty something solicitors, Anna, Miles, Milly, Egg and Warren earned itself a legion of loyal fans when it originally screened in 1997. Series devised by Amy Jenkins.

results.title: This is your stop! (April 2006)
results.brief_description: A trip through time and space: from ancient Egypt to the wild, wild west. This green screen workshop was produced as part of the G.A.T.E.ways (gifted and talented education) program for kids. The year 6 students learnt scripting, production and performance skills using virtual set technology.

results.title: This is your lung
results.creator_credit: Verity Films, Film Producers Guild and Oswald Skilbeck
results.brief_description: Designed to discourage cigarette smoking. Uses a smoking machine to show a variety of foreign matter in cigarette smoke, including a cancer-causing tar. Deals with a patient who has a smoker’s cough, but is ultimately found to be suffering from lung cancer.

results.title: This is working
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: Aboriginal people suffer an unemployment rate six times higher than the white community. Shows Aboriginal people in New South Wales who are working on four different job creation projects. Features, amongst others, Bill Powell, Aboriginal Liaison Officer TAFE, Rose Kirby, Murrin Bridge Handcraft Industries, Des Simon, apprentice carpenter, Purfleet and Dallas Carberry, park management trainee, Orient Point.

results.title: This is Ulster
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions and Richard F. Tambling
results.brief_description: A panorama of Ulster, the northern province of Ireland which forms part of the United Kingdom. Some of the country’s physical characteristics, which bear their own special brand of beauty, form the background to a survey of industrial and rural life. No reference to the simmering poitical issues.
